docs.snippet: An intensifying competition for top players has led recruiters to focus on younger girls, but many coaches and parents worry about a psychological toll....
docs.lead_paragraph: An intensifying competition for top players has led recruiters to focus on younger girls, but many coaches and parents worry about a psychological toll.
docs.abstract: Story of Haley Berg, high-school freshman who has already accepted soccer scholarship to the University of Texas, illustrates intensifying competition for top players that has led recruiters to focus on ever-younger girls; many coaches and parents worry about the physical and psychological toll that trend, among other sports as well, may take on youngsters.

headline.main: Committing to Play for a College, Then Starting 9th Grade

docs.snippet: A study of struggling African-American high school students in Chicago found that providing focused guidance sharply improved learning, but the approach is a costly one to replicate....
docs.lead_paragraph: A study of struggling African-American high school students in Chicago found that providing focused guidance sharply improved learning, but the approach is a costly one to replicate.
docs.abstract: Study released by National Bureau of Economic Research finds that providing a program of intense tutoring, in combination with group behavioral counseling, sharply improved learning for group of struggling African-American high school students in Chicago.

headline.main: Intensive Small-Group Tutoring and Counseling Helps Struggling Students
headline.print_headline: Intensive Small-Group Tutoring and Counseling Helps Struggling Students
